result.execSummary:
The defendant Ian G Magolan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash bail applied to fine and costs.  Fine and costs paid in full.
*Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ian G Magolan

Defendant Ian G Magolan in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Barry Braatz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State makes recommendations regarding sentencing.  Attorney Bricco makes statements to the Court.  Defendant makes statements to the Court.  


The Court Orders the Following to count #2:

FINE: $605.00

DNA Surcharge: $200.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 
Apply cash bail previously posted on 15CM2436 and 15CM985, the balance is to be paid as a condition of probation on case 15CM2436.
Sentencing hearing on October 27, 2016 at 10:30 am.

The Court sets 15CM2436 for trial and 2015CM985 for sentencing.  Sentencing schedules for October 27, 2016 at 10:30 a.m.
Sentencing hearing on September 26, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
